headline: Disney reaches new deal with YouTube TV, ending dayslong blackout for customers
summary: Disney and YouTube TV reached a new deal to bring channels like ABC and ESPN back to the Google-owned live streaming platform Friday, ending a blackout for customers that dragged on for about two weeks.  “As part of the new deal, Disney’s full suite of networks and stations – including ESPN and ABC – have already begun to be restored to YouTube TV subscribers,” The Walt Disney Co. said in a statement.  Disney content had gone dark on YouTube TV the night of Oct. 30, after two sides failed to reach a new licensing deal.

content.title: Disney reaches new deal with YouTube TV, ending dayslong blackout for customers
content.summary: Disney and YouTube TV reached a new deal to bring channels like ABC and ESPN back to the Google-owned live streaming platform Friday, ending a blackout for customers that dragged on for about two weeks.  “As part of the new deal, Disney’s full suite of networks and stations – including ESPN and ABC – have already begun to be restored to YouTube TV subscribers,” The Walt Disney Co. said in a statement.  Disney content had gone dark on YouTube TV the night of Oct. 30, after two sides failed to reach a new licensing deal.

headline: Disney and YouTube TV Reach Deal, Ending 15-Day Standoff
summary: Disney  and Google’s YouTube TV have signed a deal that will return popular channels such as ESPN and ABC to roughly 10 million households after a 15-day standoff, the two companies said.  As part of the pact, YouTube TV will also now be able to offer ESPN Unlimited, Disney’s new ESPN streaming service at no extra cost to customers.  YouTube TV said that feature should be available to its subscribers by the end of 2026.

content.title: Disney and YouTube TV Reach Deal, Ending 15-Day Standoff
content.summary: Disney  and Google’s YouTube TV have signed a deal that will return popular channels such as ESPN and ABC to roughly 10 million households after a 15-day standoff, the two companies said.  As part of the pact, YouTube TV will also now be able to offer ESPN Unlimited, Disney’s new ESPN streaming service at no extra cost to customers.  YouTube TV said that feature should be available to its subscribers by the end of 2026.

headline: Disney reaches new deal with YouTube TV, ending a blackout that lasted over two weeks
summary: Disney and YouTube TV reached a new deal to bring channels like ABC and ESPN back to the Google-owned livestreaming platform Friday, ending a blackout for customers that dragged on for over two weeks.  “As part of the new deal, Disney’s full suite of networks and stations — including ESPN and ABC — have already begun to be restored to YouTube TV subscribers,” The Walt Disney Co. said in a statement.  YouTube TV also confirmed the return of Disney content on its platform, noting that subscribers should see channels back “over the course of the day.”

content.title: Disney reaches new deal with YouTube TV, ending a blackout that lasted over two weeks
content.summary: Disney and YouTube TV reached a new deal to bring channels like ABC and ESPN back to the Google-owned livestreaming platform Friday, ending a blackout for customers that dragged on for over two weeks.  “As part of the new deal, Disney’s full suite of networks and stations — including ESPN and ABC — have already begun to be restored to YouTube TV subscribers,” The Walt Disney Co. said in a statement.  YouTube TV also confirmed the return of Disney content on its platform, noting that subscribers should see channels back “over the course of the day.”

headline: Disney and YouTube TV Agree to Multi-Year Deal, Ending Two-Week Blackout
summary: With another weekend of sports arriving, YouTube TV and Walt  Disney  agreed late Friday to end their carriage dispute, returning ESPN and other Disney channels to YouTube TV’s 10 million subscribers.  Disney said it had reached a multi-year distribution agreement with the  Alphabet  -owned unit.  “As part of the new deal, Disney’s full suite of networks and stations – including ESPN and ABC – have already begun to be restored to YouTube TV subscribers,” Disney said late Friday.

content.title: Disney and YouTube TV Agree to Multi-Year Deal, Ending Two-Week Blackout

Disney said it had reached a multi-year distribution agreement with the  Alphabet  -owned unit.  “As part of the new deal, Disney’s full suite of networks and stations – including ESPN and ABC – have already begun to be restored to YouTube TV subscribers,” Disney said late Friday.
